headline: Canadian inflation cools to 2.3% as gasoline prices retrench
summary: Investing.com -- The Canadian Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose 2.3% on a year-over-year basis in January, marking a slight deceleration from the 2.4% increase recorded in December. This modest cooling in the headline rate comes as global energy prices and a shifting domestic tax landscape continue to reshape the country’s inflationary profile. Gasoline prices emerged as the primary driver of the downward movement, plunging 16.7% year-over-year following a 13.8% decline the previous month. Statist
